title: How much should one score in internals inorder to get a cgpa of above 9 ?

comments.body:
Short answer is that it's difficult to say because you're talking about multiple courses each having their own course structure as well as other factors like ESA and assignments. Just try getting approximately 80% in all exam components and a full in the assignment/project.

If you want a breakdown assuming you get a full score in everything else(lmao) here it is:

So getting a 9 SGPA means you need atleast an A in every course. Getting an A in a course means 80+ out of 100 in your final score.

Let's say you get a full in ESA. Since it carries 50% weightage, that means you've already gotten a 50. 

Now your combined ISA+assignment/project score contributes to the other 50. Back in my time, this assignment/project component was on an average 10 marks. So you need 20 marks from all ISAs.

If you get 10/20 per ISA, then your best 4 score will be 40/80, scaled down will give you that 20 you need. 

So if you get 10/20 per ISA for all of them, AND get a full in assignment/project AND get a perfect 100/100 in the ESA, will you get an A grade.

See how it doesn't make sense to do this calculation? xD
